## Summary sheet ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Main use-cases Within host allele frequency, identify polyclonal infections
Authors Stuart Lee
Latest version 0.0.2.9001
Website https://bahlolab.github.io/moimix/
Code repository https://github.com/bahlolab/moimix
Publication None
Tutorial authors Sophie Bérubé
Tutorial date 13/12/2023
````` ::: ::: ## Purpose The moimix package uses biallelic SNP data output in the form of a VCF file from massively parallel sequencing platforms to estimate the following: 1. within host allele frequencies (including minor allele frequencies) 2. whether an infection is monclonal or not ## Existing resources - The [moimix website](https://bahlolab.github.io/moimix/) gives general information about data inputs, features of the package, and installation. -The [moimix vignette](https://bahlolab.github.io/moimix/vignettes/introduction.html) describes individual functions in the package, and shows a step-by-step tutorial. - The moimix package uses functions from the flexmix and SeqArray packages. - Lee S, Harrison A, Tessier N, Tavul L, Miotto O, Siba P, Kwiatkowski D, Müller I, Barry AE and Bahlo M, Assessing clonality in malaria parasites using massively parallel sequencing data, 2016, in preparation. ## Citation ``` @Manual{, title = {moimix: Estimating mulitplicity of infection from high-throughput sequencing data}, author = {"Stuart Lee"}, year = {2023}, note = {R package version 0.0.2.9001}, url = {https://github.com/bahlolab/moimix}, } ```
